locale.message: DNB Export Plugin
Export or deposit articles in DNB format.
Note: This journal is not open access, thus you have to first chose one of the possible access options for the archived articles at DNB in the plugin settings before you can proceed with the export.

In order to deposit the articles directly from within OJS, you will need to enter your DNB Hotfolder username, password and subfolder. If you do not enter these credentials, you can still export the DNB packages.
ISSN (s. Journal Settings Page) is required for export and deposit.
TAR command (s. cli part in the config.inc.php) is required for export and deposit.

Please define the access to the articles in the DNB archive:

For open access journals and articles the access to the archived version will automatically be unrestricted for all (second option). Closed journals and journals with restricted access will have to chose one of these options that DNB provides for access of the archived articles. Please note that setting access options at the issue or article level will have precedence over the setting selected here.
Restricted access (access only on specially configured computers in the DNB reading rooms).
Unrestricted access for all.
Access only for users registered with the DNB, also from outside the DNB.

Subfolder ID
This is the subfolder in your DNB Hotfolder, where the exported packages should be uploaded.
Username
Please note that the password will be saved as plain text, i.e. not encrypted.
Deposit articles to DNB automatically

OJS regularly checks if there are articles not yet deposited (that is, articles that are not deposited from within OJS and not marked as registered) and automatically deposits them to the DNB Hotfolder. Please note that this may take a short amount of time after publication to process. You can check for all not deposited articles in the articles listing.
Not deposited
Deposited

An article can have one of the following status:
Not deposited: The article has not been delivered to the DNB yet (it was not deposited to the DNB Hotfolder from within OJS and not marked registered).
Deposited: The article has been deposited to the DNB Hotfolder from within OJS.
Marked registered: The article was manually marked as registered. You may mark articles as registered (see button "Mark Registered") to indicate that the article was delivered to the DNB outside of OJS, e.g. via the DNB web form.
The selected articles were deposited!

Note: The deposit can take a long time. So please choose only a few articles each time and be patient after clicking the "Deposit" button. You'll be notified when the process is completed.
